attributes.action: Have a vote of no confidence in the Lord Chancellor
attributes.background: Liz Truss's response to the attacks in the press on the Law Lords is completely inadequate: she doesn't condemn them for saying the ruling was politically motivated but she does refer to the government's intention to appeal to the Supreme Court. She should speak for the judiciary, not the government

attributes.action: Make it easier to remove bullies from schools, at any age and fine the parents
attributes.background: As a parent, i find it outrageous that there is so much 'red tape' surrounding schools and exclusions. A child has to be excluded for a total of 45 DAYS before a permanent exclusion is warranted. Most of these exclusions are related to VERY SERIOUS incidents, but why wait for so many to take place?
attributes.additional_details: Parents whose children are victims of bullying are forced to remove their children from education for their safety, either to be home schooled or a change of school. Both of which can be extremely difficult for most. Why should victims have to change their friends, schools, routines and sometimes homes all because of bullies? It's time the bullies and their parents families faced the consequences of their childrens behaviour- not the other way round.

attributes.action: Move Trident from Scotland to Plymouth Devon
attributes.background: Scotland do not want Trident and the SNP have been fighting this vehemently . Meanwhile in Plymouth we have the capacity and would welcome the jobs with open arms

attributes.action: Include same sex relationships as grounds for divorce under adultery
attributes.background: It seems absurd that a same sex couple can get married but if one of them should stray with a same sex person outside of the marriage adultery cannot be cited as grounds for divorce.
attributes.additional_details:
The same can be said for a traditional marriage where either partner has a relationship outside with a person the same sex as themselves, this isn't recognised as adultery.

This law should be overhauled to state that having sexual relations outside of marriage with any person is adultery.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age to 21
attributes.background: Stop under 21s from voting due to lack of life experiences,

attributes.action: Stop business rate rises before they wreck independent high street retailers
attributes.background: Independent retailers in many towns face rate increases which will force them out of business. National chains are pushing up property values, and independents are paying for this in their rates. Higher property values do not mean more turnover. The unintended consequence will be bland high streets.
attributes.additional_details: The new business rates have an unsound basis. Rising property values are a cost to small retailers, not a source of profit. Increasing rates in line with property values is a double burden which will be the end for many much-loved retailers, and will turn interesting high streets into identical dull parades of chain coffee shops, charity outlets, and predictable national retailers. Local councils should not be wrecking their own high streets. Business rates need to be reconsidered.

attributes.action: Increase  healthcare spending now to a minimum of 10.6% of GDP to save our NHS
attributes.background: Our NHS and Social Care are in crisis.Staff shortages abound; ambulances wait for blocked beds, but people need care at home, and social care is missing because of Government cuts to councils.  Don't let the crisis be a tragedy, raise our spending to the level of other G7s now.
attributes.additional_details: According to the King's Fund 8/6/16 the USA, Sweden,Germany,France,Belgium,Denmark,The Netherlands,Japan,Canada,Austria all spend more % of their GDP than we do. The G7 countries spend an average of 10.6%GDP. The NHS is currently being asked to cut millions of pounds via Sustainability Transformation Strategies at a time when the whole system is in crisis.Our NHS must be protected, it is the one thing which stands for Britain, that all citizens,no matter how poor,have access to free healthcare.

attributes.action: Make HCAs/phlebotomists belong to a professional registered body.
attributes.background: I am a healthcare assistant and a phlebotomist. I started off as a HCA over 4 years ago with no experience. I think that was dangerous. Especially with the care HCAs need to give. Would be nice for all the hard work we learn as we progress, and the care we give, that we belong to a recognised body.

attributes.action: Allow UKSA to prosecute politicians who state incorrect statistics
attributes.background: In the recent campaign the Leave side kept mentioning the incorrect £350m amount going to the EU. The head of the ONS asked them to stop but they didn't. The UKSA should be able to prosecute politicians, political parties and campaigns from repeating incorrect stats and force to print retractions.
attributes.additional_details:
These 2 articles relate to the £350m claim.
https://fullfact.org/blog/2016/apr/uk-statistics-authority-350-million-eu-membership-fee-potentially-misleading/
www.theguardian.com/politics/reality-check/2016/may/23/does-the-eu-really-cost-the-uk-350m-a-week

As this article describes the UKSA are the organisation required to point out to politicians where they misuse statistics but they lack the teeth to do more.
www.bbc.co.uk/news/blogs-magazine-monitor-28061826

attributes.action: Enforce taxi companies to charge accessible taxis the same as inaccessible ones
attributes.background:
A disabled person can end up paying 3 or 4 times more for a taxi journey compared to a non-disabled person. 
The same journey in an accessible taxi was £13.50 whereas friends in an inaccessible taxi were only charged £4.50.
attributes.additional_details:
It is unfair to charge a disabled person more for the same journey because they are disabled. 
Having a disability is already expensive, adding another cost to someone purely because they require a wheelchair (or other mobility aides) is discriminatory. 
The Equality Act 2010 Section 15 states that a person cannot be treated unfavourably because of their disability. 
Therefore I call on the government to change legislation so that disabled people aren't charged more due to their disability.

attributes.action: Parliament to postpone the implementation of Article 50, for at least 6 months.
attributes.background: Further to the recent European Referendum, it now appears evident that the European Union acknowledges that changes must be made to better meet the current needs of member countries.  The UK should not leave the European Union until such time as the extent of any proposed changes are known.
attributes.additional_details: If those proposals still fall short of UK requirements for continued membership it will then be possible to negotiate exit arrangements with better knowledge of the future EU structure and conditions.

attributes.action: Link a dog owners national Insurance number to microchip details.
attributes.background: I have owned dogs for over 25 years. I am passionate about rescues and the hard work they do to ensure a dogs welfare. I am livid! That animal abuse is not taken more seriously in this country. Animal abusers should be put on a list.
attributes.additional_details: The amount of animal abuse videos I see the amount of dogs in rescues who struggle to make ends meet could be lowered. Micro chipping is law now in this country for dogs. Why can we not pass a law that states that when you get a dog you have to attach your national insurance number to said dog?? If you sell this dog rehome or put no rescue or even dump and you do not change NI details any costs incurred should be billed to the last NI on record, this way any costs made could be received back.

attributes.action: Stop plans for Transition Government in Zimbabwe that includes ZANU PF ministers
attributes.background: ZANU PF and life President Robert Mugabe via a system of patronage over the last 36 years has systematically destroyed the economy of Zimbabwe & impoverished its people. At the same time elite Ministers and cronies have become wealthy beyond measure, by effectively looting Zimbabwe's resources.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government in it's secretive Foreign Office has unilaterally decided that a TRANSITIONAL GOVERNMENT will be put in place to avoid "REGIONAL CHAOS" [sic], WHICH WILL INCLUDE the "elite" referred to in the previously. 
ZANU PF Ex-Ministers/Civil Servants/Sponsors cannot in any form be linked to Government or control of Finances. 
They will simply use this money to rig the 2018 elections as they have clearly done in 2008 and 2013 by using DEADLY VIOLENCE and systematic VOTER FRAUD

attributes.action: We want bully's expelled from school. No second chance.
attributes.background:
Lets influence school's 
kick the bully out on the first strike.
Fine the parents, keep the rejects away from our decent children!
Why should the victims be taught at home while the Teachers Governors and Police sit back. Why do bully's receive more help than their victims?

attributes.action: Create special funding for the victims of racial hatred & bigotry postreferendum
attributes.background: After the brexit referendum was won, there has been a nasty upsurge in racial attacks & xenophobia in general.  We need to create special funding for the victims of this vile abuse, whether it be for counselling or repairs, whatever their needs. Also we need to ensure police resources to combat it.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-devon-36737529
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/eu-referendum-racism_uk_576fe161e4b08d2c56396075
https://secure.avaaz.org/en/petition/MPs_also_the_PM_David_Cameron_Provide_additional_funding_for_victims_of_hate_crimes/edit/

insurmountable evidence that there was was a latent problem & this referendum result has validated these bigot. So now we need to help drive it down into the cracks & crevices again.

attributes.action: Allow Scotland, Gibraltar, & possibly NI to inherit EU membership if they choose
attributes.background: That the UK voted to Leave whilst 1 territory and 2 nations voted to Remain poses obvious constitutional questions. The government should address those as a democracy, and offer apt constitutional arrangements (eg Scottish independence; others are more complex) which allow them to stay in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK's Brexit negotiations should allow polities to opt-out and inherit EU membership.

This avoids a gap between losing EU membership within the UK and regaining it under Article 49 accession.

Democracy (not Scottish nationalism) demands a referendum in Scotland.

New constitutional paths should be explored for Gibraltar and Northern Ireland that respect their links to UK, economic ties to EU and (esp NI) complex politics. 

Any changes should coincide with (and depend on) Brexit.

attributes.action: Ban the use of quad bikes dirt bikes on all public roads.
attributes.background: Dirt bikes & quad bikes are becoming a real nuisance on public roads & public parks all over the U.K. The police are unable to do anything. This needs to be stopped now before someone gets seriously hurt.

attributes.action: Make Asthma Treatment FREE For Asthma Sufferers
attributes.background: I am a life long Asthma Sufferer. I was born with the conditions and throughout my life, I have always wondered why other conditions such as Diabetes and Epilepsy get free medication?
attributes.additional_details:
I am most worried about the 250,000 with severe (uncontrollable) asthma. It's thought they make up more than half of asthma deaths. Costs of their treatments can be considerable - they often need powerful steroid tablets and antibiotics.

Emergency hospital admissions for adults are estimated to cost the NHS £61 million a year and many relate to poor asthma control. 

Better access to medicines keeps people healthy, out of hospital and working. 

Those who manage the budget always look to save money, but charging asthma patients for prescriptions is a back-to-front and morally questionable way to do it.

attributes.action: Allow parliament to vote on whether or not we stay within the single market
attributes.background: People voted for brexit thinking it would be done in an orderly fashion with an input from everyone in parliament, not by a committee created by an unelected prime minister. Brexit should be done with everyone in mind, no one asked for a crippled pound and a damage to the economy.
attributes.additional_details: The European Single Market enables free trade within the EU, helping 26 million UK businesses and access to a market worth over £9 trillion. Membership of the single market would allow us to enjoy the same trade benefits and support British companies even after we have left the EU. Continued tariff-free trade will preserve confidence in the British economy, but with Theresa May's current plan, it would require leaving the block, our economy will go down and the working/middle class will suffer.

attributes.action: Call on UK government to stop dealing immediately with Sudan Government
attributes.background: Based on testimony from caregivers and survivors, Amnesty International estimates that more than 200 people may have died as a result of exposure to the chemical weapons agents, with many being children.The majority of survivors of the chemical weapons attacks have had no access to medical care.
attributes.additional_details:
An Amnesty International investigation has gathered horrific evidence of the repeated use of what are believed to be chemical weapons against civilians, including very young children, by Sudanese government forces in one of the most remote regions of Darfur over the past eight months.
Please take an action to end this aggression and dangerous crimes of Sudan Government.

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2016/09/sudan-credible-evidence-chemical-weapons-darfur-revealed/

attributes.action: MPs to debate ending Southern (Govia) rail franchise amid ongoing failures.
attributes.background: Southern has proved incapable of running a rail service, shifting blame on to the unions, Network Rail and even passengers for expecting to be able to get to and from work on time! Cutting nearly 350 daily services hasn't helped; MPs must act to take the franchise away and give metro routes to TfL.
attributes.additional_details:
www.standard.co.uk/news/transport/southern-rail-should-be-placed-under-immediate-control-of-tfl-sadiq-khan-says-a3299956.html

www.standard.co.uk/news/transport/southern-rail-commuters-fury-as-birkbeck-station-is-left-without-any-trains-to-central-london-a3294956.html

www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/jul/15/rail-minister-claire-perry-resigns

www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/southern-rail-timetable-trains-services-times-cancellations-disrupted-strikes-cuts-a7130401.html

attributes.action: Repeal Scotland Act 1998 and 2016 Amendments and dissolve Holyrood
attributes.background: On 26th June First Minister Nicola Sturgeon threatened to veto UK succession from the EU despite the country voting by over 1.2 million votes to leave. Such action is in contravention to democratic will. Westminster should reverse Scottish devolution to prevent the SNP's constitutional overreach

attributes.action: GIVE VOTING RIGHTS TO EU NATIONALS LIVING IN UK FOR MORE THAN 15 YRS
attributes.background:
In the Brexit referendum, Brits living abroad less than 15 years and all
Commenwealth citizens living in the UK were allowed to vote. It does not make sense for the government not to allow EU citizens to have a vote.
attributes.additional_details:
EU citizens living in the UK contribute financially, they are here legally and are often not allowed to vote in their home countries.
Equal rights should include the right to vote.
If the government has decided that Brits living abroad for more then 15 years should not be able to vote, then it should be obvious to grant EU citizens living here for 15 years and more the right to vote.
Many of the European nationals have not changed their passport because there was no need to.

attributes.action: Make chrons disease a disability
attributes.background: Its hard to get out most days as when you have this disease you are constantly on the toilet.You cant even get out of bed most days your belly hurts that much it feels like you are in labour 24/7 please help us we all look fine on the outside but feel so bad on the inside.

attributes.action: All Government forms, publications in English or English/Welsh languages only.
attributes.background:
All Government forms and publications should be printed in English or English/Welsh languages only.
The public sector is estimated to spend  140 million a year on translation services.
attributes.additional_details:
Local councils spend at least £25m; the police £21m; the courts system spends more than £10m without accounting for the cost of legal aid; and the NHS - a conservative estimate is £55m.
The Human Rights Act only requires translation if someone is arrested or charged with a criminal offence.
Translating is not only expensive it is doing harm because it reinforces the language barrier which separates communities from the rest of Britain and hinders integration.

attributes.action: Government to debate epilepsy in 2017. We all need HM Government help.
attributes.background: We need MPs help to get epilepsy recognised and recognised in schools. Employers to understand and to place us all in jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
To date teachers, employees and the majority of the public fail to recognise what epilepsy is and how to deal with it. 

We are normal everyday people who in suffer from an illness. Please give us a chance in life.

attributes.action: I wish the Home Office to review the case of a Fijian soldier Semesa Maiyale.
attributes.background: Semesa Maiyale known as Sam joined the British army in 2003 and served with the Kings Own Scottish Borders and then the Royal Regiment of Scotand serving nine years,completed tours of Iraq and was promised the right to remain in the Uk after his service ended.
attributes.additional_details: Sam was discharged in 2012, Sam has no right to work, cannot claim benefits or housing and is supported by his partner who as a staff nurse is having to provide for the both of them and their son. sam rightly feels betrayed and let down.

attributes.action: Stop companies touting tickets for huge profits & stopping fans going to events
attributes.background: Companies like 'Get Me In' & 'Stubhub' allow tickets to be resold for insane prices. In some instances, they are on these sites before fans even get the chance to buy them. I propose that touting sites have a maximum of a 5% mark up so as to allow fans to go to events without being extorted!
attributes.additional_details: 09.09.16 - Tickets for both UFC and even Green Day appeared almost staright after general sale 'selling out' for double the value of the actual ticket. In the cae of UFC tickets, they were appearing on 'Get Me In' within 2 minutes of the general sale beginning.

attributes.action: Article 50 should not be implemented without a debate and vote in parliament.
attributes.background: Implementing The Lisbon Treaty Article 50 will be one of the most important decisions that Britain has made for many years as there will be no going back.  It should not be left to the Executive to make this decision without recourse to parliament for debate and ratification by a vote of all MPs.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/brexit-eu-referendum-leave-article-50-lisbon-treaty-a7100436.html

attributes.action: Additional Law for Police to seize stationary Uninsured/Unregistered vehicles
attributes.background: Currently Police don't have the power to seize vehicles that are parked unattended and uninsured on our roads under S.165 Road Traffic Act 1988 if its taxed etc. A huge problem is criminals buying these cars, not being the registered owner therefore evading possible penalties incurred.
attributes.additional_details:
A REGISTERED vehicle which has INSURANCE will be traceable when it comes to NtO (Fines) etc... 
But if Un-registered / Un-Insured = No parking fines, No speeding fines EVER and driver/owner untraceable to authorities unless they are caught in the act with the vehicle. I petition to enforce a power for police to seize any vehicle on a public road that is not lawfully insured regardless if the owner has been caught driving it or not.
We must be Proactive and not Reactive in crime prevention!

attributes.action: Conviction of violence towards NHS staff hold a mandatory custodial sentence
attributes.background: Too many NHS staff are being assaulted whilst trying to help those in need and a mandatory custodial prison sentence needs to be in place for anyone convicted of it.

attributes.action: ALL coffee, tea , cocoa, chocolate sold in UK to be Fair Trade certified.
attributes.background: Free of EU Trade Restrictions - this petition calls for legislation to end Slavery in the tea, coffee and cocoa farming industries. It calls upon the Government to pass a law requiring ALL tea and coffee and cocoa (chocolate) sold in the UK to be Fair Trade (or Rainforest Alliance) Certified.
attributes.additional_details:
Ask yourself: Is it right that tea that is sold in the UK may be picked by people in bonded labour who have to live amongst their own sewage? Is it fair that the chocolate you buy as an after-school treat for your children contains cocoa picked by a farmer who can’t afford to send her own children to school?

I have dreamt for many years that Britain would one day act to end modern Slavery. Such a law will demonstrate that the UK is outward looking and compassionate, and truly define a new era!

attributes.action: The IPCC to have control over decisions in an investigation against the police.
attributes.background: We the undersigned, want a change in law so the IPCC have total control over all decisions in an investigation against the police. For example; when an officer has been suspended on a criminal charge. This has come to our attention after the fatal shooting of Jermaine Baker.

attributes.action: Local councils must adhere to The Care Act; by offering choice of care provider.
attributes.background: In an attempt to reduce cost councils (LA's) are removing the right of choice from those who receive care and support. By appointing one provider forcing people to accept the care provider offered rather than the one better placed to support them.
attributes.additional_details:
Central to the Care Act 2014 is wellbeing. At the heart of the principle of wellbeing is ‘control over day- to-day life, including over care and support and the way it is provided.’

This is because choice and control is fundamental to the core purpose of adult care and support which the Care Act guidance sees as being to ‘help people to achieve the outcomes that matter to them in their life.’ 

Current practice is not recognising the legialation introduced to protect vulnerable people.

attributes.action: ban betting advertising and sponsorship on television and UK press.
attributes.background:
the level of betting advertising is growing out of control.
Its everywhere;
TV adverts
Programme sponsorship
TV channel sponsorship
Sports event sponsors

Most offer free bets, or free money bets as incentives.

Gambling is addictive and destroys family life.
attributes.additional_details:
The way in which betting companies advertise need strict control, to curb the ever increasing problem of gambling addiction.
The massive increase in the number of online betting sites being able to fund such promotional activity is testimony to their success at the expense of UK households.

This is not the kind of enterprise we should be promoting.

attributes.action: Ensure the Royal Navy does not lose its long-range anti-ship missile capability
attributes.background:
The MoD has admitted that the Royal Navy's Harpoon anti-ship missile will go out of service in 2018 with no replacement specified. The shorter range Sea Skua missile also goes out of service, not to be replaced until 2020.

This means the Royal Navy will lack a ship-killing capability for sometime
attributes.additional_details:
Rear-Adml Chris Parry, said: "It's a significant capability gap and the Government is being irresponsible. It just shows that our warships are for the shop window and not for fighting."

Lord West of Spithead, a former First Sea Lord, said: “This is just another example of where the lack of money is squeezing and making the nation less safe. We will have this gap of several years without missiles. Well, that’s fine if you don’t have to fight anybody in the meantime.”

attributes.action: Make the Work Capability Assessment illnesss specific
attributes.background: The Work Capability Assessments for the past five years have been heavily directed towards physical disability which is irrelevant to those suffering from mental illnesses. This makes it almost impossible for anybody with a mental illness to be assessed accordingly.
attributes.additional_details: Examples of the assessments carried out for all claimants, regardless of their condition, be it mental or physical include: reaching, standing and sitting, absence or loss of control of the bowel, consciousness during waking moments and picking up or moving and transferring. This is part of a long list of many assessments which do not relate to mental illness. This has meant that people with mental health problems, signed off work by a doctor and or psychiatrist are often declared fit for work, resulting in a decline in their health and often suicide. We ask that the assessments are specific to the disability of the claimant in order to obtain a fair assessment of that individual's disability.

attributes.action: Introduce 'Gender Neutral' public toilets across the UK.
attributes.background:
The UK should scrap gender segregated public toilets by replacing them as gender neutral. 
Allowing people of any gender or gender identity to use the facility without the feeling of any fear, harassment, judgement, discrimination or abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
As part of the LGBT community myself, I find going to a gendered public toilet a scary experience and I'm sure I'm not alone.

I have experienced harassment in both male and female toilets and find its becoming more frequent. I believe myself and others should be able to do their business in peace without being questioned.
I feel 'neutralising' the gendered signage of all public toilets would provide a more comfortable and safer environment.

attributes.action: Create new Animal and Domestic Pet Protection legislation to imprison abusers
attributes.background: Britian is a nation of animal lovers, with an estimated 46% of households having a domestic pet. Unfortunately however, animal cruelty offences continue to occur, with very little in the way of "animal rights" to prevent them, or to punish offenders. Pets mean more than the "property" defined in law
attributes.additional_details:
Recently introduced legislation in the US will allow courts to treat those who abuse animals in the same vein as humans. Numerous physiological research conclude that one of the first steps towards a person being mentally capable of taking another human life often start off abusing and killing animals

At the moment pet homocide can only be treated as 'criminal damage', but with people like the Croydon cat killer freely walking the streets we believe stronger legislation should be introduced.

attributes.action: Grant maintenance loans to full time distance learning students
attributes.background: I'm a student studying at the open university and I have chosen to study full time, this means I don't have time for a job, however I am only eligible for a part time tuition fee loan as I am a distance learning student, this means I only get my tuition fee paid for.
attributes.additional_details: As distance learning students we have to study harder because we don't have as many face to face lectures with out tutor and those of us that choose to do our degree full time are not eligible for a maintenance loan to help support us through our studies like other full time students which then means since we don't have time for a full time job and sometimes a part time job either depending on out degree we have to find other ways to support us financially through our studies.

attributes.action: Make wrongful online doxing a criminal offence
attributes.background: Many people, often children, have their private details leaked online. This may include their phone number, address, or even personal photos. This is a form of cyber bullying if the person did not give permission for their details to be leaked. It is essential for this online attack to be illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
www.studyweb.com/doxing/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doxing
www.gohacking.com/what-is-doxing-and-how-it-is-done/

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for patients to have a full blood count every 6-12 months
attributes.background: My 2 year old was poorly despite going to the doctors and seeing 3 different ones it was all dismissed as nothing and even though I asked for a blood test for her we were refused. I took her to A+E and the morning after she was diagnosed with luekemia on 06-04-16.
attributes.additional_details: My daughter at 2 years old was poorly for a few weeks with aches and pains, unexplained bruising, weight loss, constant fatigue and tiredness and a swollen face. GPS were of no help and we were dismissed each time. It took my health visitor to tell the gp there was something wrong for them to tell her to tell me to go to A+E the next day she was diagnosed with T-ALL and the swelling in her face was due to a tumour in her chest pressing on her airways she couldn't breathe properly + needed oxygen

attributes.action: Hold a UK referendum on the future of the union between Scotland and England.
attributes.background: Now the result of the EU referendum is known, the Scottish Government considers the prospect of a second Scottish independence referendum 'on the table'. A National referendum would allow for the will of the entire electorate to be known on the future of the Union formed in 1707.
attributes.additional_details: Some are calling, as in 2014, for the rest of the UK to have a voice in the question of Scottish independance. Many Scots, resident elsewhere in the UK or even Expats who were eligible to vote in the EU referendum, were not eligible for the 2014 independence referendum.

attributes.action: Introduce a law for all branded takeaway coffee cups to be easily recycled.
attributes.background:
Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall has alerted us all to the environmental damage that the humble coffee cup can cause. 
See his war on waste program: http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b07m8qwz
If legislation was introduced to force the large coffee chains to act then this problem would quickly disappear.

attributes.action: Strip Thameslink franchise, bringing back a British Rail government run service
attributes.background: Thameslink have failed for years. Customer satisfaction is low and journeys unsafe and infrequent. We need a train service fit and reliable for the needs of London and UK economy. Strip Thameslink of franchise, stop blaming years of under funding and bring back British Rail government run trains.
attributes.additional_details: This petition demands the return of government run franchise not having profits put before customer levels of safety and satisfaction. Bring back a British Rail system for failing train companies and hold them accountable in the way failing NHS or schools are supported and improved. Make UK mirror London and open for business 24hrs

attributes.action: Create and support a Women in Engineering Charter
attributes.background: Theresa May recently celebrated the Women in Finance Charter to tackle gender inequality. The lack of STEM capability in the UK is becoming a crisis, we need to take action to ensure there are opportunities for all. We need a diverse industry to provide infrastructure and services for a diverse UK!
attributes.additional_details:
This is the Women in Finance Charter: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/women-in-finance-charter

Lets replicate this for the engineering, including technology, sector.

attributes.action: Subsidise train fares for 16-18 year olds in full-time education
attributes.background: My 2 sons best mode of transport to School is the train.We just paid £191 for my 15 year old for this term(6wks) and my 16yr old £382 for the same journey just because he turned 16!!He is still in the same school.16 -18 year olds in full time education should not be paying adult fares
attributes.additional_details: I challenged GWR( the rail company in this instance but other tail companies are also guilty) and I was told that there is a 16 - 25 year old 1/3rd off discount card which sounded brilliant except you can't activate it before 10am or you pay £12 flat day rate which works out more expensive than an adult season ticket.The 1/3rd discount card is a fraud as it does not do what it says!!. What 16 - to 25 year old goes anywhere meaningful daily after 10am? Students and workers take earlier trains.

attributes.action:
Bring out Identity Cards that hold DNA
details for EVERYONE living/enters UK
attributes.background: it's time to get a world wide data base, starting with the UK. everyone either Born/living/entering the uk should have to submit their DNA & then receive a Biometric ID card a cross between a bank card & a driving licence type. the results of less police hours would out weigh the cost of the cards.
attributes.additional_details:
not only would they cut down police hours saving the force money, they would free up officers to do deal with more crimes. as well as tracking down rapists and killers (where DNA was found) a lot quicker they would also help family's that have lost loved ones due to horrific circumstances,
i,e where a body is either badly composed or mutilated, the police could check DNA database and say ok this is them meaning that the family will not have a life time of a horrific image of their loved ones.

attributes.action: Make mental health services more accessible
attributes.background: To make mental health services more accessible the Government should ensure that  no-one who approaches a mental health service should be turned away without help.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone who goes to their GP or any other health care professional who is experiencing a mental health problem should be automatically referred to the crisis team who should act immediately. The onus should not be on the individual to contact the Crisis Team on their own. There should also always be a one to one therapy option, rather than group therapy.

Many people will know I haven't had an easy time with life or with mental illness; I suffer with depression anxiety PTSD and OCD. Recently, I've hit rock bottom and have screamed for help but have been let down by mental health services who I thought would help, instead they have let me down majorly.

attributes.action: Preserve all existing rights of UK citizens to Freedom of Movement in the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum text did not instruct the Government to sign away UK citizens' current rights to travel, reside, work, study, or retire freely anywhere in the EU, without discrimination. Though on Brexit we lose EU citizenship, the Govt. has a duty to preserve our rights in its Brexit Agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
These Factsheets summarise your current rights of Free Movement 1) as EU citizens, & 2) via UK membership of the Single Market. You will lose these rights unless they are protected. 

1) Free Movement of Persons: (skip the Schengen section) http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_2.1.3.html 
2) Free Movement of Workers: (different emphasis: this is oriented to the Single Market): http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_3.1.3.html
